reviewText: The Gruffalo's Child is just as cute as The Gruffalo!  Both have soothing, beautiful music and are narrated by an all-star cast.  My kids absolutely love this story!  It starts with the Gruffalo telling his little girl about "The Big Bad Mouse."  This show makes my kids giggle and gasp.  It's 40 minutes long which is a perfect amount of time for me to get the kitchen cleaned. :)
Title: The Gruffalo's Child  [Region 2] (2011)

reviewText: The Gruffalos Child is a good movie.  If I didn't see the first one with my son...not too sure about it.  The Gruffalo movies are a nice change to the normal junk for kids movies.
summary: If you saw the first one
Title: The Gruffalo's Child  [Region 2] (2011)

reviewText: We enjoy both of these films.  Well done!  Great story!  Appropriate for young children.  My three year old daughter loves it.
Title: The Gruffalo's Child  [Region 2] (2011)

reviewText: I bought this as a Christmas gift for a grandchild. She gets bored with everyday TV so I buy her movies to watch.  They are great for a young child's imagination.
Title: The Gruffalo's Child  [Region 2] (2011)

reviewText: What an enchanting story about a young Gruffalo and her father. Her father tells her of the Big Bad Mouse who lives in the forest and she wants to find out more. Her adventure leads her into the forest where she meets many creatures and of course the Mouse. She learns to be brave but also learns her father will protect her always.The DVD which tells the story is wonderful . It really makes the story come alive. You can see the facial expressions and the story is enhanced with more details as the young Gruffalo searches for the Big Bad Mouse.It is a nice family story that I know you and your children will enjoy watching.
Title: The Gruffalo's Child  [Region 2] (2011)

reviewText: Whether you are a fan of the first "Gruffalo" story, or if you are being introduced to him and his child for the first time, you are sure to love this charming film.  A snow-filled winter evening deep in the forest makes a gorgeous setting for this fantasy-filled tale of a young fantastical creature, the young gruffalo, who sets off in search of the "big, bad mouse."  After evading a fox, a snake, and an owl, the young gruffalo finally comes across the clever little mouse, who outsmarts her in the end.  It is such a clever story and is sure to be loved by children of all ages.  I love it about as much as my three year old son.  Highly recommend!
Title: The Gruffalo's Child  [Region 2] (2011)

reviewText: The language, and storyline is suitable for preschool through early elementary school years. 4 year old test subject really enjoyed it. Graphics are decent. Narrative is interesting without being difficult.
Title: The Gruffalo's Child  [Region 2] (2011)

reviewText: If you have a two or three year old - or even a four year old - this movie is so cute you will want to watch it with them.  The animation is the best I've seen and the music is beautiful and haunting.  It is a simple story about a father and daughter -- the father tells his daughter to never go into the woods alone...and, of course, she goes into the woods alone...but it has a happy ending.
Title: The Gruffalo's Child  [Region 2] (2011)

reviewText: This is a great addition to your collection.If you have and love the books you will love the film too.Even though we have this for family movie night - the kids still beg to read the book.  Just all around great!!
Title: The Gruffalo's Child  [Region 2] (2011)

reviewText: Great family movie. This movie is only 40 minutes long.  Wish it was a little longer but the story is great.
Title: The Gruffalo's Child  [Region 2] (2011)

reviewText: This is a great sequel to The Gruffalo!  We have the sound books as well.  The animation doesn't seem as rich and beautiful as the first film mainly because it's a darker and a wintertime tale.  However it has the same great actors voicing it. It's a bit scarier than the first one.  My toddler loves it but has to watch it on our laps.  It's short like the first one, just 30 minutes long.  The sound book is great too!
Title: The Gruffalo's Child  [Region 2] (2011)
